intro: Hieracium alboviride, commonly known as the white-green hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are typically clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium alboviride is often found in meadows and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
